# VZSerialPortConfiguration

**Class**

The common configuration traits for serial port requests.

## Declaration

```swift
class VZSerialPortConfiguration
```

## Overview

Don’t create a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZSerialPortConfiguration] object directly. Instead, instantiate a concrete instance of one of its subclasses, such as [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioConsoleDeviceConfiguration]. Use the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZSerialPortConfiguration/attachment] property of this class to configure the medium through which serial communication happens.

## Configuring the Attachment Point

- **attachment**: The object that defines how the configuration of the virtual machine’s serial port interfaces.

## Configurations

- **VZVirtioConsoleDeviceSerialPortConfiguration**: A configuration object that requests the creation of a console device to communicate with the guest system.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- VZVirtioConsoleDeviceSerialPortConfiguration

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
